sentences: Ernst Heinrich "Teddy" Stauffer (2 May 1909 â€“ 27 August 1991) was a Swiss bandleader, musician, actor, nightclub owner, and restaurateur.
He was dubbed Germany's "swing-king" of the 1930s.
He formed the band known as the Teddies (also known as the Original Teddies or the International Teddies), which continued after he left in 1941.
Until 1939, he appeared with his Original Teddies-Band especially in Berlin and Hamburg.
Stauffer, Teddy, Forever is a Hell of a Long Time: An Autobiography (1976) ISBN 0-8092-8089-2
